STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR,HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. R1 BY ADV. SRI.SIJU MATHEW R2 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT. P.MAYA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 02-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: sts Di eed ce zt f] eau BE] Sea 2014/KER/235 CRMC.NO.70/2014 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S ANNEXURES: ANNEX A1 COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT. RESPONDENT'S ANNEXURES: NIL ITRUE COPY/ P.A.TO.JUDGE sts 2014/KER/235 P.BHAVADASAN, J. ~ CrLM.C. No. 70 of 2014 Dated this the 02 day of January, 2014 ORDER This is a petition filed under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. seeking to have all further proceedings in C.C. 1977 of 2013 pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kasaragod, which arose out of Crime No. 147 of 2013 of Kumbala Police Station quashed. 2. The petitioner stands accused of having committed the offences punishable under Sections 342 and 324 of IPC. 3. It is unnecessary to go into the facts and details of the case for the simple reason that the petitioner has impleaded the defacto complaint/victim as _ the first respondent who has entered appearance through a counsel and the learned counsel appearing for the second respondent has accepted that the affidavit filed along with this petition is one sworn to by the first respondent herself Bh Ents ape 2014/KER/235 CrI.M.C. No.70/2014 -2- and she stands by the statements contained therein. 4. On going through the said affidavit, it is seen that the parties have settled all their differences and issues between them and no further grievance remains to be redressed. It is also pointed out in the affidavit that the defacto complainant is not interested in prosecuting the matter further. 5. In the light of the stand taken by the defacto complainant, it is felt that continuance of the proceedings will only be an exercise in futility. Hence, this petition is allowed. All further proceedings in C.C. 1977 of 2013 pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kasaragod including the final report based on which cognizance was taken shall stand quashed and the petitioner shall stand discharged. Sd/- P.BHAVADASAN JUDGE ds
